title: Differences in quantities between two balls

content.prompt: Two balls, A and B, have the same mass and diameter but are made from different types of rubber. The balls are dropped from the same height above the floor. After colliding with the floor, ball A bounces higher than ball B bounces. Which of the following quantities must necessarily be larger for ball A than for ball B?

choices.label: The average force exerted by the floor
The amount of time in contact with the floor
The momentum just before colliding with the floor
The kinetic energy just before colliding with the floor

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
